net.viktorc.pp4j.impl

Class SimpleProcessExecutor

  • Object
    • SimpleProcessExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Runnable, ProcessExecutor

    public class SimpleProcessExecutor
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    An implementation of the ProcessExecutor interface that allows for the running and management of a process based on a ProcessManager instance to enable the execution of submissions in this process. The process may be launched by invoking the start() method and submissions may be executed in the process using the execute(Submission) method.
    Author:
    Viktor Csomor

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleProcessExecutor(ProcessManager manager)
      Constructs a process executor instance using the argument to manage the life-cycle of the process.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
           throws InterruptedException
        It launches the underlying process and blocks until it is ready for the execution of submissions.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while waiting for the startup to complete.
        IllegalStateException - If the process is already running.

      • stop

        public boolean stop(boolean forcibly)
        It prompts the currently running process, if there is one, to terminate. Once the process has successfully terminated, subsequent calls are ignored and return true.
        Parameters:
        forcibly - Whether the process should be killed forcibly or using the ProcessManager.terminateGracefully(ProcessExecutor) method of the ProcessManager instance assigned to the executor. The latter might be ineffective if the process is currently executing a submission or has not started up yet.
        Returns:
        Whether the process was successfully terminated.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns whether the underlying process is currently running.
        Returns:
        Whether the process is running at the moment.

      • join

        public void join()
          throws InterruptedException
        It blocks the calling thread until the underlying process terminates. If the process is not running, it immediately returns.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread has been interrupted while waiting for the process to terminate.

      • execute

        public boolean execute(Submission<?> submission)
        Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutor
        Sequentially writes the specified commands to the process and blocks until they are processed. The result of the submission, if there is one, can be subsequently accessed by calling the Submission.getResult() method.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface ProcessExecutor
        Parameters:
        submission - The submission to execute.
        Returns:
        Whether the submission was executed. If the executor is not running, busy processing an other submission, or stopped before it could complete the execution of the submission, false is returned; otherwise the submission is processed and true is returned once it's successfully executed.

      • onExecutorStartup

        protected void onExecutorStartup(boolean orderly)
        A method called after the startup of the process and the set up of the executor but before it is declared ready for submissions.
        Parameters:
        orderly - Whether the executor startup has been orderly or not. If it has not been orderly, the executor is shut down.

      • onExecutorTermination

        protected void onExecutorTermination()
        A call-back method invoked after the termination of the underlying process and the stopping of the executor's helper threads.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws Exception
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        Exception

      • isStopped

        protected boolean isStopped()
        Returns whether the termination of the underlying process has been initiated.
        Returns:
        Whether the termination of the process has been initiated.

      • execute

        protected boolean execute(Submission<?> submission,
                          boolean terminateProcessAfterwards)
                   throws IOException,
                          InterruptedException
        Executes the specified submission synchronously by delegating its commands to the underlying process serially and processing the responses of the process.
        Parameters:
        submission - The submission to process and execute.
        terminateProcessAfterwards - Whether the process should be terminated after the execution of the submission.
        Returns:
        Whether the execution of the submission has completed successfully.
        Throws:
        IOException - If there is an error while writing to the standard in of the process.
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted during the execution.
        NullPointerException - If submission is null.

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
